flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction_rendered:
Relevant parts
  • broken guitar
  • Speakers
  • Speaker wire
  • short wood screws
Tools
  • Jigsaw
  • Metal ruler
  • Soldering iron
  • cordless drill
  • math compass
  • soft pencil

lines.text: I first measured out where I wanted to place the speakers using the ruler or a tape measure.
lines.text_raw: I first measured out where I wanted to place the speakers using the ruler or a tape measure.

lines.text: I measured out the centre of the guitar and drew a centre line parallel to the guitar neck (see picture). I then used a math compass to draw the circles to be cut out.
lines.text_raw: I measured out the centre of the guitar and drew a centre line parallel to the guitar neck (see picture). I then used a math compass to draw the circles to be cut out.

lines.text: Note: Make sure when drawing the circles to give the speakers enough distance from each other.
lines.text_raw: Note: Make sure when drawing the circles to give the speakers enough distance from each other.

lines.text: I suggest drawing the circle at the sound hole first as it will give you an idea as to how much space you have left to play with.
lines.text_raw: I suggest drawing the circle at the sound hole first as it will give you an idea as to how much space you have left to play with.

lines.text: After drawing the second circle I began cutting.
lines.text_raw: After drawing the second circle I began cutting.

lines.text: I suggest weighing the guitar down with something heavy to prevent vibrations while cutting the holes with a jigsaw. Start carefully and if there is too much vibration add more weight.
lines.text_raw: I suggest weighing the guitar down with something heavy to prevent vibrations while cutting the holes with a jigsaw. Start carefully and if there is too much vibration add more weight.

lines.text: After cutting out the first speaker hole I used the cordless drill to make a small hole in the centre of the second circle to be able to cut out the second speaker hole.
lines.text_raw: After cutting out the first speaker hole I used the cordless drill to make a small hole in the centre of the second circle to be able to cut out the second speaker hole.

lines.text: Next I drilled a hole in the bottom of the guitar to thread the speaker wires through.
lines.text_raw: Next I drilled a hole in the bottom of the guitar to thread the speaker wires through.

lines.text: Note: Give yourself enough slack and tie a knot to prevent accidentally ripping out the cables from the speakers.
lines.text_raw: Note: Give yourself enough slack and tie a knot to prevent accidentally ripping out the cables from the speakers.

lines.text: I used the soldering iron to attach the wires to the speakers. You may find that old speakers tend to have more than enough solder on them  already to make a good connection. (If not, just add a little extra. ;) )
lines.text_raw: I used the soldering iron to attach the wires to the speakers. You may find that old speakers tend to have more than enough solder on them  already to make a good connection. (If not, just add a little extra. ;) )

lines.text: Now all I needed to do is screw the speakers to the guitar using the wood screws.
lines.text_raw: Now all I needed to do is screw the speakers to the guitar using the wood screws.

lines.text: I suggest first placing the speakers in as you see fit and marking out where the screws shall go in. Then pre-drill the marked spots to prevent the wood from splintering and then turn the screws in.
lines.text_raw: I suggest first placing the speakers in as you see fit and marking out where the screws shall go in. Then pre-drill the marked spots to prevent the wood from splintering and then turn the screws in.

lines.text: Feel free if you like to then seal off the wire hole with some hot glue.
lines.text_raw: Feel free if you like to then seal off the wire hole with some hot glue.

lines.text: And that's it.  All you need to do now is connect the speakers, turn up the volume and enjoy the sound. :)
lines.text_raw: And that's it.  All you need to do now is connect the speakers, turn up the volume and enjoy the sound. :)

guide.summary: This guide shows how I turned my old broken guitar into a speaker enclosure.
